IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The older American act intends that the area agency on aging shall be the leader relative to all aging issuers on behalf of all older persons in the planning and service area. This means that the area agency shall proactively carry out, under the leadership and direction of the state agency, a wide range of functions related to advocacy, planning, coordination, inter-agency linkages, information sharing, brokering, monitoring and evolution, designed to lead to the development or enhancement of comprehensive and coordinated community based systems in, or serving, each community in the planning and service area. These systems shall be designed to assist older person in leading independent, meaningful and dignified lives in their own homes and communities as long as possible.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The older American act intends that the area agency on aging shall be the leader relative to all aging issuers on behalf of all older persons in the planning and service area. This means that the area agency shall proactively carry out, under the leadership and direction of the state agency, a wide range of functions related to advocacy, planning, coordination, inter-agency linkages, information sharing, brokering, monitoring and evolution, designed to lead to the development or enhancement of comprehensive and coordinated community based systems in, or serving, each community in the planning and service area. These systems shall be designed to assist older person in leading independent, meaningful and dignified lives in their own homes and communities as long as possible.
IRS990.Desc: Veterans direct home community based services - providing in-home care to veterans referred by the veterans administration. Service coordinators provide assessment and assist the veteran employer with self-directing their care needs in their home through assisting them with managing their monthly service plan and budget, hiring and scheduling staff to meet their needs and avoiding institutional care.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Nutrition services - provides education, training, and resources allowing individuals and families to obtain and prepare quality, nutritional meals. Services include both congregate meal settings (43,152 meals served in FY22) and home delivered meals (65,942 meals served in FY22).

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Information, referral, and assistance - provides a link between people in need with the appropriate services for their unique situations. State certified technicians maintain databases of service providers and local resource information including social and health services, Medicare/Medicaid assistance, legal services and utility, meals and other direct assistance. The program had 5,425 contacts with seniors in FY22.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Provisions for income taxes have not been recorded in these financial statements because the organization believes it had no income unrelated to its exempt purposes in 2022 and 2021. With few exceptions, the organizations information return (IRS form 990) is not subject to examination by tax authorities for years before 2019.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AGENCY'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS INCLUDE MONTHLY REVIEW OF EXPENSES, ONSITE MONITORING OF ACTIVITIES, AND DESK REVIEWS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part III, Line 4d: Other Program Services Description
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 4: In-home care and caregiver provides home-based services such as nursing, personal care, transportation, and homemaking services to enable elderly with the greatest economic and social needs to remain in their own homes. The caregiver program also aids caregivers by making information and assistance available to caregivers, provides for individual counseling, support groups, and training to caregivers, and provides for respite care services. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 5: Older American Act provides a variety of services, primarily by contract, such as congregated and home-delivered meals, homemaker, home chore, respite care, transportation, health screening services, telephone reassurance, outreach, and other services designed to maintain the independence of the clients, allowing them to live with dignity in their own homes for as long as possible. Area Agencies are charged with encouraging planning for development and maintenance of such local programs, in addition to monitoring each contractors performance and adherence to program rules and regulations, while assuring appropriate reporting and accountability for resources. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 6: Ombudsman provides information and assistance to residents and their families in an effort to ensure the best care and quality of life possible for residents. A Long Term Care (LTC) Ombudsman is an advocate for residents living in nursing homes and assisted living facilities. LTC Ombudsmen resolve conflicts and provide education regarding rights making routine visits to each facility so residents have an opportunity to voice their concerns. WMTAOA staffs both the Local Certified LTC Ombudsman for its service area and the Regional LTC Ombudsman.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The agency provides a draft copy of the form 990 to each board member at a regularly scheduled board meeting for review and discussion prior to finalization.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The board annually reviews the conflict of interest policy and members must disclose any conflicts noted. Board members must disclose immediately any conflict of interest that arises during the normal course of business and excuse themselves from further discussion.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The agency's policies and organizational documents are available upon request. The agency's form 990 tax return is available upon request.
